name: Geolocation. Removing a property from an object.
instruction:
The GPS sensor sends data with the coordinates of the point on the map.

Write a function `geoLocation` that takes one parameter:
* `location` - object that contains information about the point on the map;

The `location` object has the following structure:
* `country` - country, string
* `alt` - altitude above sea level, string
* `lat` - latitude, string
* `lon` - longitude, string

The function should return an object in which geolocation will not be tied to the country - remove the `country` property from the `location` object.

Example of running the function:
```javascript
geoLocation({country: "Canada", alt: "1387.2", lat: "51.1815723", lon: "-115.5846221"})
// {alt: "1387.2", lat: "1387.2", lon: "51.1815723"}
```
